occupation: Chief Executive Officer at Maior Strategic Consulting
headline: CEO @ Maior | Driving Excellence in Professional Services Firms | Strategy, Operations, Growth, and Legal Background
summary:
I help professional services firms frustrated by flat revenue and falling margins, stuck putting out fires instead of fueling growth, or disappointed by outdated strategies that no longer deliver.    

I founded Maior on the premise that "good enough" hasn't ever been good enough for me, and my holistic approach to improving firms comes from spending a decade in client service as a litigator and then having the privilege of serving in roles ranging from the inaugural COO of a national law firm to managing operations and strategy for enterprise firms (KPMG and BDO) and building the growth division of a midsized communications consulting firm.

If “good enough” isn’t enough for your firm either, there are three primary ways I can help you: 

1. Improving financial performance – from revenue to profit margin. 
2. Building innovative strategies – to power growth or solve your problems.  
3. Creating better processes – consistent with your culture and maximizing performance. 

I love helping growing firms skyrocket, early-stage organizations maintain their "special sauce" as they scale, and mature businesses gain fresh perspectives. I’ve led departments from facilities to finance, and operate either as a fractional C-Suite resource so you get a depth of experience on a part-time basis and budget, or as your strategist and change agent to solve specific issues holding back your firm. 

>>> Check out www.maiorconsultants.com to learn more about my company.

>>> Get in touch if you think we’d get along, are seeking a new thought partner, or want to know more about working with me.

accomplishment_publications.name: Law Firm Strategies For Successfully Navigating 2024 Trends
accomplishment_publications.description:
The legal industry, like others, is in the midst of economic uncertainty and changing workforce expectations – and there’s opportunity to stand out for the firms willing to pivot. 

Law firms face a dual challenge entering 2024. Externally, deal work has remained stunted and clients are seeking more value given tighter budgets, necessitating a sharper focus on firms’ revenue sources and value propositions. Internally, increasing costs and sluggish movement back into the office are pressing firms to rethink traditional operational models to maintain margins, firm culture, and institutional knowledge. 

This article serves as a playbook for navigating the current trends that will define and differentiate the law firms of 2024. The leaders of tomorrow's legal landscape are those who adapt to stakeholder needs with agility, reimagine their infrastructure to empower a dynamic workforce, and judiciously channel resources to spark growth and loyalty in a competitive ecosystem for clients and talent alike.

accomplishment_publications.name: Maximizing Law Firm Profitability in Uncertain Times
accomplishment_publications.description:
The historic expectation in law firms has been for professionals, from partners to staff, to navigate largely on intuition, crafting on-the-fly strategies from the top of the revenue funnel (e.g., business development) to the bottom (e.g., handling write-offs). But law firm teams are stretched thin and weary; they need better guidance to not only enhance firm profitability and efficiency, but bring them increased time and certainty.   

Firms’ mission to their clients is clear: to offer value and transparency in every interaction. For internal teams, it’s time to establish systematic processes — from creating channels that measure client satisfaction to handling pushback on bills — and arm teams with the tools they need. For partners in particular, the narrative needs to change; it’s not merely about chasing higher top-line figures but understanding the power of bottom-line management. After all, leaky buckets are an expensive way to gather water. 

The truth that’s often overlooked? While firms are engrossed in the revenue race, they can push far more revenue to the bottom line. Driving profitability involves reimagining processes to create an ecosystem where strategic financial oversight meets evolved client relations, teams are empowered to do better instead of more, and value to clients is clear and uncontested.
